fields.name: observation_id
fields.description: Unique identifier (within a project) of the observation.

fields.name: deployment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the deployment this observation belongs to. Foreign key to `deployment:deployment_id`.

fields.name: sequence_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the sequence (collection of multimedia files grouped by a predefined `sequence_interval`) that is the source of this observation. Foreign key to `media:sequence_id`.

fields.name: media_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the multimedia file that is the source of this observation. Foreign key to `media:media_id`. Include but leave empty for sequence-based observations.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Date and time of the observation, as an ISO 8601 formatted string in UTC (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`). For file-based observations this is the `timestamp` of the associated multimedia file (in `media_id`), for sequence-based observations the `timestamp` of the first multimedia file in the associated sequence (in `sequence_id`).

fields.name: observation_type
fields.description: Type of observation. All categories in this vocabulary have to be understandable from an AI point of view. `Undefined` describes classifications with a confidence level below some predefined threshold i.e. neither humans nor AI can say what was recorded.

fields.name: sensor_method
fields.description: Method of triggering the camera for this observation.

fields.name: camera_setup
fields.description: `true` if this observation is part of the camera setup process (camera deployment, pickup, maintenance).

fields.name: scientific_name
fields.description: Scientific name of the observed individual(s).

fields.name: vernacular_name
fields.description: Common name of the observed individual(s), preferably in English.

fields.name: is_domesticated
fields.description: `true` if the observed individual(s) are domesticated.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of observed individuals (optionally of given age, sex and behaviour: see below).

fields.name: count_new
fields.description: Number of new (= previously uncounted) individuals in the associated multimedia file (`media_id`) taking into account the entire sequence (`sequence_id`) (optionally of given age, sex and behaviour: see below).

fields.name: age
fields.description: Age of observed individual(s)

fields.name: sex
fields.description: Sex of observed individual(s)

fields.name: behaviour
fields.description: Dominant behaviour of observed individual(s), ideally expressed as controlled values (e.g. grazing, browsing, rooting, vigilance, running, walking).

fields.name: individual_id
fields.description: Unique identifier (within a project) of the observed individual.

fields.name: classification_method
fields.description: Classification method.

fields.name: classified_by
fields.description: Name or unique identifier of the person or AI algorithm that classified this observation.

fields.name: classification_date
fields.description: Date and time when this classification was made, as an ISO 8601 formatted string in UTC (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`).

fields.name: classification_confidence
fields.description: Accuracy confidence of the classification. Specified as probability, with `1` being maximum confidence. Provide an approximate value for human classifications.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: Internal attribute of data management system: ID of this observation.
